tit.cmt: タイトルを補足しました。

sen.j: 華族令（かぞくれい）は、日本の法令。
sen.e: The Kazoku-rei (Peerage Law) was a Japanese act.
The Kazoku-rei was a Japanese act.
sen.cmt: (Peerage Law) は既出のため削除しました。
sen.e: The Kazoku-rei was a Japanese act.

sen.j: 明治17年（1884年）に制定された明治17年宮内省達無号と、それを廃して明治40年に制定された皇室令がある。
sen.e: There were the Kunaisho (Ministry of the Sovereign's Household) Notice Mugo enacted in 1884 and the Koshitsu-rei (the Imperial Families' Act) which took place of the abolished former Notice in 1907.
There were the Imperial Household Ministry Notice Mugo (unnumbered) enacted in 1884 and the Koshitsu-rei (the Imperial Families' Act) which took place of the abolished former Notice in 1907.
sen.cmt: 「宮内省」 Imperial Household Ministry としました。（より一般的と思われるため）「無号」を補足しました。
sen.e: There were the Imperial Household Ministry Notice Mugo (unnumbered) enacted in 1884 and the Koshitsu-rei (the Imperial Families' Act) which took place of the abolished former Notice in 1907.

sen.j: 明治40年制定の華族令（明治40年皇室令第2号）は昭和22年（1947年）に廃止された。
sen.e: The Kazoku-rei enacted in 1907 (the Imperial Families' Act Notice No.2, 1947) was abolished in 1947.
The Kazoku-rei enacted in 1907 (the Imperial Families' Act Notice No.2, 1947) was abolished in 1947.
The Kazoku-rei enacted in 1907 (the Imperial Families' Act Notice No.2, 1947) was abolished in 1947.
Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 華族を身分の高い順から、公爵・侯爵・伯爵・子爵・男爵の5爵に区分した。
sen.e: The peerage was divided according to the highness of their lineage into five classes such as duke, marquis, count, viscount and baron, kuguyo (high court nobles), daimyos and others were given noble titles according to their family status and deeds of valor and also people with merits to Japan also were raised to the peerage.
The peerage was divided into five classes: duke, marquis, count, viscount and baron, in descending order of rank.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処「身分の高い順から」の表現を変えました。
sen.e: The peerage was divided into five classes: duke, marquis, count, viscount and baron, in descending order of rank.

sen.j: 公卿・諸侯などに家格・勲功によって授爵し、国家に勲功ある者も華族に列した。
sen.e: Kugyo (high court nobles) and daimyo (feudal lords) were given noble titles according to their family status and deeds of valor, and people who had rendered distinguished services to the state were also raised to the peerage.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処「公卿」スペル修正しました。スペースを削除しました。daimyos and others→daimyo (feudal lords) としました。「国家に勲功ある者」の表現を変えました。
sen.e: Kugyo (high court nobles) and daimyo (feudal lords) were given noble titles according to their family status and deeds of valor, and people who had rendered distinguished services to the state were also raised to the peerage.

sen.j: 1889年貴族院令により30歳以上の公爵・侯爵は全部、ほかは互選で貴族院議員になる特権を有した。
sen.e: All of dukes and marquises, who were 30-year-old or more and others who were elected by mutual vote had a privilege of entering the House of Peers.

According to Kizokuin-rei (the House of Peers Act) in 1889, the privilege of entering the House of Peers was accorded to all the dukes and marquises aged 30 and over, and others who were elected by mutual vote.
sen.cmt: 「1889年貴族院令により」訳漏れのため、追加しました。（貴族院令－定訳不明）語順を変え、前後を調整しました。who were 30-year-old or more→aged 30 and over としました。
sen.e: According to Kizokuin-rei (the House of Peers Act) in 1889, the privilege of entering the House of Peers was accorded to all the dukes and marquises aged 30 and over, and others who were elected by mutual vote.

sen.j: 本令は皇室令及附属法令廃止ノ件（昭和22年皇室令第12号）により、昭和22年5月をもって廃止された。
sen.e: The act was abolished by the Matter on the Abolishment of the Koshitsu-rei and the Attached Act (the Imperial Families' Act No.12, 1947) in 1947.
The act was abolished by the Matter on the Abolishment of the Koshitsu-rei and the Attached Act (the Imperial Families' Act No.12, 1947) in May 1947.
sen.cmt: May を追加しました。（訳漏れ）
sen.e: The act was abolished by the Matter on the Abolishment of the Koshitsu-rei and the Attached Act (the Imperial Families' Act No.12, 1947) in May 1947.
